abstract: Carlos Tevez's refusal to play was wrong, but it will someday be forgotten just the same.
snippet: Carlos Tevez's refusal to play was wrong, but it will someday be forgotten just the same.
lead_paragraph: Steve Bartman went to a ball game. He tried to do what millions of baseball fans would love to do and catch a ball. No more, no less. But he interfered with play and was vilified because of it. He ceased being human and became a verb, a figure of hatred and of fun. The fact that he was a man of honor really meant nothing. What he did that night defined his life.

headline.main: Tévez's Shrug Heard Round the World
